creator: harpo@mclink.it
text:
Page redirection on an error 400 does not work. If I put in httpd.conf a line
like that:

ErrorDocument 400 /error.html

it appears to be just ignored, no errors or warnings whatsoever in logfiles, and
the usual built-in "Bad request" page is returned to the user instead. Error
handling with a text string (e.g. ErrorDocument 400 "Boo!!!) works as expected.

Checked it on three different servers with similar configuration (Apache
1.3.26/PHP 4.2.2). The same line works fine on Apache 1.3.22.

creator: nd@perlig.de
text:
It works for me in general. There are, however, some cases, where ErrorDocument
400 may not work. (e.g. if you put it into a VirtualHost container and the
request contains a broken Host header).

So please give us some more information about your test case (what request? does
the errordocument file works on direct request? special configuration?
(mod_rewrite?) etc.)

Thanks.

creator: adam.rice@efi.com
text:
Does ErrorDocument 400 ever work inside a VirtualHost section at all? I'm using
IP-based virtual hosts, so it should be able to pick the correct ErrorDocument
regardless of how malformed the request is. I've tried every kind of malformed
header I can think of, but they are all either ignored or result in the built-in
"Bad Request" error page.

If this is not expected to work at all, it would be helpful to mention it in the
documentation.
